data_table.description: Participant Safety Screening Form, Visit 5. Participants with or without atherosclerosis and cardiovascular disease and involved in the "Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities (ARIC) Cohort" project.

variable.name: SUBJECT_ID
variable.description: ARIC subject ID [Participant Safety Screening Form]

variable.name: PSA1
variable.description: Q1. Are you on any medication for diabetes or any other medication prescribed by a physician that needs to be taken on a schedule? Medication [Participant Safety Screening Form]
variable.value: Yes, Report on Exam Itinerary Checklist

variable.name: PSA2
variable.description: Q2. Do you need any other medical support that we should be aware of? Medical support [Participant Safety Screening Form]
variable.value: Yes, Report on Exam Itinerary Checklist

variable.name: PSA3
variable.description: Q3. Do you have either a heart pacemaker or defibrillator (AICD)? Heart device [Participant Safety Screening Form]

variable.name: PSA4
variable.description: Q4. Has a doctor or health professional ever recommended that you not take albuterol? Doctor recommended no albuterol [Participant Safety Screening Form]

variable.name: PSA5A
variable.description: Q5a. Have you had a heart attack, stroke, eye surgery, or surgery to your chest or abdomen in the last 6 months? Heart attack, stroke, or eye surgery [Participant Safety Screening Form]

variable.name: PSA6
variable.description: Q6. Have you ever had a repair of your aorta - the big artery in your abdomen? Aorta repaired [Participant Safety Screening Form]

variable.name: PSA6A
variable.description: Q6a. Was this done by a surgery to your abdomen or with a graft inserted into an artery in your groin? Surgery method [Participant Safety Screening Form]

variable.name: PSA0AY
variable.description: Q0a. Year of completion date [Participant Safety Screening Form]

variable.name: PSA5B
variable.description: Q5b. Have you been told by a doctor that you had bleeding inside your eye or the retina, or a tear or detachment to your retina? Bleeding inside the eye or retina, or tear or detachment [Participant Safety Screening Form]
